contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Several [[ship]]s of [[United States Navy]] were named '''USS ''Flusser''''' for [[Charles W. Flusser|Charles Williamson Flusser]]: * The first [[USS Flusser (1864)|''Flusser'']] was captured in 1864 and sold in 1865. * The second [[USS Flusser (DD-20)|''Flusser'' (DD-20)]] was a [[Smith class destroyer|''Smith''-class]] [[destroyer]], commissioned in 1909 and sold in 1919. * The third [[USS Flusser (DD-289)|''Flusser'' (DD-289)]] was a [[Clemson class destroyer|''Clemson''-class]] destroyer, commissioned in 1920 and scrapped in 1930. * The fourth [[USS Flusser (DD-368)|''Flusser'' (DD-368)]] was a [[Mahan class destroyer|''Mahan''-class]] destroyer, commissioned in 1936 and decommissioned in 1946. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Flusser}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
